content.description: Climb up to the large roof either using the dirty chimney or the holds on the face to somewhat chossy holds in the roof. Awkwardly pull the roof and follow the unsecure crack to the anchors.
content.location: Climbs the obvious finger crack above the roof to the left of Some Assembly Required.

content.description: Climb a overhanging grey face on sustained pockets and crimps to a sit down rest. Finish on steeper but  easier climbing. A pretty damn good rock climb.
content.location: Far right side of Chaos Wall.  To the left is an open project "Wolverine".  To the right is the 13a "Resistor".   Just look for the line of well chalked pockets.

content.description:
Near

Lithuanian Princess

locate a huge intimidating roof with fixed chains. This is Swamp Gator, do some powerful and harder than it looks climbing to get to the roof then campus or burl your way through the roof to the chains. Radical.
Start in the overhung cave and traverse the rail, heel-hooking your way to the lip. Pull the face with some burly moves, make a couple clips and finish the route on easier terrain.
This route starts with a hard move off the ground to large plates and jugs above.
content.location: This route is the last route on the right of the plated face you come to when on the approach trail.

content.description: Start just right of a crack in the wall and move through some slopey holds between the 1st and 2nd bolt. Get to the good undercling to clip the 3rd bolt and eye down the crux to your left. Traverse left with big spans and poor feet to reach the jug on the corner. Continue up a mossy crack to the ledge. Finish on bigger holds with a couple punchy moves.
content.location: This route starts just right of a crack which is the trad line "The 2nd Law" (the trad route ends at an anchor on the ledge 40 feet up).

content.description: Starts on a few vertical ledgy moves up to a black slab. Use the arete to pull through the crux or some tricky calf burning shenanigans. Ends on a surprisingly bad ledge. Usually wet.
content.location: Up the hill and around the corner, It's the obvious short slab with glue ins. Just to the left of Broken Dreams

content.description:
Climb the face next to

Switch

. Very bouldery first half. Then take a good sit down rest. Finish on a very steep powerful section on small pockets. Great rock and beautiful climbing.

Start in the back of the cave and climb through pumpy sequences out the chossy roof. Pull the lip and enjoy the reprieve of much easier climbing until it kicks back again. It keeps you engaged on decent edges all the way.
content.location: Middle of the big undercut cave at the main section of cliff you first walk up to. This follows the line of holds out the right side of the cave.

content.description: Utilizing the cheater stones to the right of the cave, step off the ground and traverse leftwards towards the first bolt.  Climb the easy, but slightly dirty slab up to the steep face above.  Cranks on crimps, with the occasional jug takes you to the top of the wall.
content.location: Starts to the right of the roof routes.  Start just left of the 5.6 "Some Assembly Required".  Once established traverse left to the first bolt.

content.description: Start off a ramp of boulders up the vertical face through sequential crimp sequences separated by better holds. Continue up to the roof then power over on edges and crimps to gain better holds to the chains.
content.location: Once the approach trail meets the crag near Swamp Gator, continue up the hill to the left about 100 feet. This is the middle line up the tall, mostly vertical wall with a body-length roof cutting across at ~50ft.

content.description: A hard move off the ground leads to better holds but an extremely pumpy face for the grade above.
content.location: This route starts on the large pile of cheater stones in the middle of the amphitheater.

content.description: Start on steep rock for a few bolts. The wall gets less steep with a boulder problem in a crack. Cruise on jugs to anchors
content.location: This route can be found by walking around to the right from the main wall, past the short bolted line Slabalicious, and the short off width gear line. This is the next bolted line on the taller wall, and climbs through a cool water runnel that starts 3 bolts up.

content.description: Climb the pocketed face to a large hueco staying right of the hueco to keep it fun. Follow a few more holds up to bolted anchors.
content.location: This line climbs the left of the two short bolted routes up the left side of the small amphitheater.

content.description: Boulder up through small pockets and underclings until a dynamic move to the namesake hold. Rest then continue up the steep wall above. With more traffic, this route should clean up nicely -- especially the upper headwall.
content.location: On the right side of Chaos is the "Power Grid," consisting of many bouldery, powerful routes. Electric Dong is located in the left-middle section of the wall -- look for the protruding dong hold just below the break.

content.description: Climb up to what looks like a blank face just to find a perfect jug that lets you reach up to another perfect jug just left of the bolt. Crappy dirty rock finishes the route.
content.location: The route climbs the right of the two routes on the left side of the amphitheater.

content.description: This line starts with a hard move off the top of the boulder (Be sure to stick clip it) to great movement on small edges to a bit of crux about three quarters of the way up. The slightly overhung face is sure to pack a bit of a punch.
content.location: This is the most left route at this crag climbing the slightly overhanging face to the left of the amphitheater. Starts on top of a boulder that is up against the cliff.

content.description: Start 10 ft left of Electric Dong. Technical pocket pulling leads to a big move and a good rest before the climbing gets steeper. Circumnavigate a scary hollow flake on good holds then take on the final heartbreaker crux to finish.
